Hey guys

This is my first posting here in the Exchange ...

Well my first craft here anyways ...

But I come asking for help

I have this little helicopter ... using Damned Aerospace and Damned Robotics

But it seems to be super nose heavy ... no matter how far back I move the rotors ...

Can anyone help .. or is it just me who cant fly this thing

Craft file - The Bug
Moving the rotors back would only make it more nose heavy, try moving them forward.
My first suggestion would be just to move that heavy ASAS to the back of the craft between the tail and the fuselage. That should balance it right out.

Nope ... Neither of those things helped .....

But it is 245am here ... So it can wait ... but it looks pretty and does Petit saut

Here you go all balanced for you (slightly nose heavy on take off, but evens out when going greater than 10 m/s. Thats how I think the balancing is best at least for heli's) and here is a screenshot of it landed on the VAB.

Download: <a href=http://www.filedropper.com/thebug_1>The Bug download</a></div>
Wow .... I cant work out what you did ... but it flys like a treat now .... including a loop to loop ... and a nose dive ... (which I didnt pull out of in time ... RIP Jeb)
I just moved the rotor on the top forward. :L
